Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Inhaled Epoprostenol vs. Inhaled Nitric Oxide in Lung Transplantation

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised, blinded, parallel-designed equivalence trial involved 201 adult LT patients

Participants.evidence: Eligibility included adult patients undergoing single or bilateral LT.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was severe/grade 3 primary graft dysfunction (PGD-3) at 24, 48, or 72 hours post-LT.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomised 1:1 to iNO or iEPO using computer-generated sequences with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding encompassed participants, clinicians, data managers, and statisticians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 201 patients were randomised; 103 to iEPO and 98 to iNO.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In the intention-to-treat analysis, PGD-3 occurred in 46/103 (44.7%) iEPO and 39/98 (39.8%) iNO

Result_Outcome.evidence: PGD-3 occurred in 46/103 (44.7%) iEPO and 39/98 (39.8%) iNO, with a risk difference of 4.9% (TOST 90% CI, –6.4% to 16.2%; P = .02 for equivalence).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
